items.label: Hosting a Static Website on GitHub Pages
What is GitHub & Why Use It?

CSS/box-model.title: Box Model
CSS/box-model.description: Every HTML element is a box! The box model is the secret to spacing, borders, and layout.

CSS/introduction-to-css.title: Introduction to CSS
CSS/introduction-to-css.description: Welcome, style wizard! 🎨 Now that you know HTML, it’s time to make your web pages beautiful with CSS (Cascading Style Sheets). If HTML is the structure of your house, CSS is the paint, wallpaper, and decorations that make it shine.

CSS/layout.title: CSS Layout
CSS/layout.description: You’re doing great! Now, let’s arrange elements on the page. CSS layout is how you build headers, sidebars, footers, and more.

CSS/layout-techniques.title: Layout Techniques
CSS/layout-techniques.description: CSS gives you powerful tools to arrange elements on the page.

CSS/projects.title: CSS Projects
CSS/projects.description: Congratulations! 🎉 You’ve learned the basics of CSS. Now it’s time to practice with some fun projects.

CSS/selectors.title: CSS Selectors
CSS/selectors.description: Great start! Now, let’s learn how to target specific HTML elements with selectors. Selectors are like magic wands—you point at what you want to style.

CSS/selectors-and-properties.title: Selectors & Properties
CSS/selectors-and-properties.description: Selectors are how you target HTML elements to style them. Properties are what you change (like color, font, size).

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: Welcome to the ultimate guide for JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and React Native development! Whether you're building dynamic web apps or cross-platform mobile applications, this documentation has you covered with clear, practical resources.

Git/basic-commands.title: Basic Git Commands
Git/basic-commands.description: Great start! Now, let’s learn the most important Git commands. These are your tools for saving, viewing, and sharing your work.

Git/branching.title: Branching in Git
Git/branching.description: Awesome! Now, let’s learn how to work on new features without breaking your main code. Branches are like parallel universes for your project.

Git/github-workflow.title: GitHub Workflow
Git/github-workflow.description: You’re doing great! Now, let’s learn how to share your code online and collaborate with others using GitHub.

Git/introduction-to-git.title: Introduction to Git
Git/introduction-to-git.description: Welcome, version control hero! 🦸‍♂️ Ready to save your code and track every change? Git is your time machine for projects. It lets you record, rewind, and collaborate—so you never lose your work.

Git/projects.title: Git Projects
Git/projects.description: Congratulations! 🎉 You’ve learned the basics of Git and GitHub. Now it’s time to practice with some real-world projects.

GitHub/actions-cicd.title: GitHub Actions (CI/CD Basics)
GitHub/actions-cicd.description: GitHub Actions lets you automate tasks like testing and deploying code. CI/CD stands for Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment, which means automatically building, testing, and releasing your code when you make changes.

GitHub/code-reviews.title: Code Reviews
GitHub/code-reviews.description: Code reviews let team members check each other's work before merging changes. This helps catch bugs, improve code quality, and share knowledge.

GitHub/collaboration.title: Collaboration on GitHub
GitHub/collaboration.description: GitHub makes it easy to work with others. Common collaboration features include:

GitHub/creating-cloning-repos.title: Creating & Cloning Repositories
GitHub/creating-cloning-repos.description: A repository (repo) is where your project lives on GitHub. You can create a new repo to start a project or clone an existing one to your computer.

GitHub/example-auto-deploy.title: Example: Auto-Deploying a Site
GitHub/example-auto-deploy.description: You can use GitHub Actions to automatically deploy your website when you push changes. For example, you can set up a workflow to deploy to GitHub Pages or another hosting service every time you update your code.

GitHub/git-clone.title: git clone
GitHub/git-clone.description: The git clone command copies a repository from GitHub to your local computer. This lets you work on the project offline.

GitHub/hosting-github-pages.title: Hosting a Static Website on GitHub Pages
GitHub/hosting-github-pages.description: 1. Push your website files (HTML, CSS, JS) to a GitHub repository.

GitHub/introduction.title: Introduction to GitHub
GitHub/introduction.description: GitHub is a web-based platform that helps developers store, manage, and collaborate on code. It uses Git, a version control system, to track changes and enable teamwork. With GitHub, you can work on projects with others, contribute to open source, and showcase your work to the world.

GitHub/pages.title: GitHub Pages
GitHub/pages.description: GitHub Pages lets you host static websites directly from your GitHub repository. It's free and great for personal, project, or documentation sites.

GitHub/projects-kanban.title: GitHub Projects (Kanban Boards)
GitHub/projects-kanban.description: GitHub Projects help you organize and track work using Kanban boards. You can create columns like "To do", "In progress", and "Done" to visualize tasks and progress.

GitHub/protecting-branches.title: Protecting Branches
GitHub/protecting-branches.description: Protecting branches helps prevent unwanted changes. You can set rules so only certain people can push, or require code reviews before merging. This keeps your main code safe.

GitHub/uploading-project.title: Uploading a Project to GitHub
GitHub/uploading-project.description: To upload (push) your project to GitHub:

GitHub/what-is-github.title: What is GitHub & Why Use It?
GitHub/what-is-github.description: GitHub is a hosting service for Git repositories. It makes it easy to share code, collaborate with others, and manage projects. Developers use GitHub to:

GitHub/workflows.title: What are Workflows?
GitHub/workflows.description: A workflow is a set of automated steps that run on GitHub Actions. Workflows can build, test, or deploy your code whenever you push changes or open a pull request.

GitHub/writing-good-readme.title: Writing Good README Files
GitHub/writing-good-readme.description: A good README helps others understand and use your project. Include:

HTML/accessibility-seo.title: Accessibility & SEO Basics
HTML/accessibility-seo.description: Make your site usable for everyone and easy to find! Accessibility means everyone—including people with disabilities—can use your site. SEO (Search Engine Optimization) helps your site show up in search results.

HTML/attributes.title: HTML Attributes
HTML/attributes.description: Awesome! Now let’s make your elements more powerful with attributes. Attributes add extra information to elements—like giving your car a color or your phone a ringtone.

HTML/elements.title: HTML Elements
HTML/elements.description: Great job starting your HTML journey! 🏗️ Now, let’s talk about elements—the building blocks of every web page.

HTML/elements-and-attributes.title: Elements & Attributes
HTML/elements-and-attributes.description: Great job starting your HTML journey! 🏗️ Now, let’s talk about elements and attributes—the building blocks of every web page.

HTML/forms.title: HTML Forms
HTML/forms.description: You’re doing great! Now, let’s learn how to collect information from users with forms. Forms are how websites get input—like sign-ups, searches, or feedback.

HTML/forms-and-input-types.title: Forms & Input Types
HTML/forms-and-input-types.description: You’re doing great! Now, let’s learn how to collect information from users with forms. Forms are how websites get input—like sign-ups, searches, or feedback.

HTML/introduction-to-html.title: Introduction to HTML
HTML/introduction-to-html.description: Welcome, web explorer! 🌐 Ready to build the foundation of every website? HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is where it all begins. Think of HTML as the structure of your house—the walls, doors, and windows that shape your web pages.

HTML/media.title: Media (Images, Audio, Video, Iframes)
HTML/media.description: Bring your pages to life with media! HTML lets you add images, audio, video, and even embed other sites with iframes.

HTML/projects.title: HTML Projects
HTML/projects.description: Congratulations! 🎉 You’ve learned the basics of HTML. Now it’s time to practice with some fun projects.

HTML/semantic-html.title: Semantic HTML
HTML/semantic-html.description: Let’s make your pages meaningful! Semantic HTML uses tags that describe their purpose, making your code easier to read and better for accessibility and SEO.

Javascript/Beginner/arrays.title: Arrays
Javascript/Beginner/arrays.description: Hey, code rockstar! 🎸 You've got functions nailed, so now let’s dive into arrays—your go-to tool for storing lists of stuff. T#### What's Next?

Javascript/Beginner/control-structures.title: Control Structures
Javascript/Beginner/control-structures.description: Whoa, code adventurer! 🧭 You've mastered operators, so now let's give your programs a brain—control structures! These are like choose-your-own-adventure books for code: they let your script make decisions based on conditions. No more straight-line code; now it can branch out, skip parts, or choose paths.

Javascript/Beginner/functions.title: Functions
Javascript/Beginner/functions.description: Hey, code ninja! 🥷 You're looping like a champ—now let's talk functions, the superheroes of reusable code. Functions let you bu#### WFunctions are your code's superpowers—reusable and awesome! Next, we'll tackle arrays to store lists of data. Dash to Arrays to keep rocking it. You're coding like a pro—keep shining! 💥at's Next?

Javascript/Beginner/introduction-to-java.title: JavaScript Basics
Javascript/Beginner/introduction-to-java.description: Hey there, future coder! 🚀 Welcome to the magical world of JavaScript (often just called JS). If you're new to programming, don't worry—we're starting from the very beginning. Think of JavaScript as the secret sauce that makes websites come alive: buttons that respond when you click them, forms that check your input, and even games right in your browser.

Javascript/Beginner/loops.title: Loops
Javascript/Beginner/loops.description: Greetings, loop master in training! 🔄 You've got decisions down pat—now let's add repetition to the mix. Loops are like your code's treadmill: they run the same block over and over until a condition says "stop!" Why? To handle lists, count things, or repeat actions without copying code a zillion times. Imagine printing "Hello" 100 times manually—boring! Loops make it effortless.

Javascript/Beginner/objects.title: Objects
Javascript/Beginner/objects.description: Hey, coding superstar! 🌟 You've conquered arrays, and now it’s time to meet #### WObjects are your data superheroes, organizing everything neatly! You've now got the beginner basics down—variables, loops, functions, arrays, and objects. Time to put it all together with some fun projects! Jump to Beginner Projects to build a Digital Dice Roller, Random Joke Generator, and Simple Calculator. You're ready to create—let's do this! 🎉at's Next?

Javascript/Beginner/operators.title: Operators in JavaScript
Javascript/Beginner/operators.description: Hey, code explorer! 🌍 You've got variables and data types under your belt—now it's time to make them dance with operators. Operators are like the tools in your coding toolbox: they let you add, compare, and combine things in fun ways. Think of them as math symbols on steroids, but for all kinds of data.

Javascript/Beginner/projects.title: Fun Beginner Projects
Javascript/Beginner/projects.description: Wow, you’ve made it through the JavaScript basics—time to celebrate by building something awesome! 🎉 These three mini-projects—Digital Dice Roller, Random Joke Generator, and Simple Calculator—will put your skills to work. You’ll use variables, functions, arrays, objects, and loops, plus a touch of HTML and CSS to make them interactive on a webpage. Each project is beginner-friendly, includes full code, and runs in your browser. Let’s create some magic! 🪄

Javascript/Beginner/variables-and-dataty.title: Variables and Data Types
Javascript/Beginner/variables-and-dataty.description: Hello again, aspiring JavaScript wizard! 🌟 If you've made it here from the basics, pat yourself on the back—you're already writing code that runs in the browser. Now, let's level up by learning how to store and work with information in JS. Think of this as packing your backpack for a coding adventure: variables are your bags, and data types are the stuff you put inside.

Javascript/Intermediate/advanced-functio.title: Advanced Functions
Javascript/Intermediate/advanced-functio.description: You’ve conquered the basics—variables, loops, arrays, objects, and functions—and now it’s time to supercharge your functions with some intermediate magic. Functions are the heart of JavaScript, and these advanced techniques will make them more powerful, flexible, and fun to use. Think of this as upgrading your coding toolbox with shiny new gadgets!

Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.title: Asynchronous JavaScript
Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.description: Hey, time-traveling coder! ⏰ You’ve mastered DOM manipulation and ES6+ features—now it’s time to conquer asynchronous JavaScript, the magic that lets your code handle tasks that take time, like fetching data, waiting for timers, or responding to user clicks without freezing the page. JavaScript is single-threaded (one task at a time), but async tricks make it feel multitasking!

Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.title: JS Asynchronous Operations
Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.description: Time to peek behind the curtain! ⏰ You've learned about callbacks, but how does JavaScript actually handle asynchronous operations? Let's explore timers, events, and the magical event loop that makes it all work. Understanding this will make you a better async programmer!

Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.title: JS Callbacks
Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.description: Welcome to the world of callbacks! 📞 You've actually used these before in our advanced functions section, but now we're diving deeper into their async superpowers. Callbacks are the OG way to handle tasks that take time—they're functions passed to other functions to run when something finishes (or fails).

Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.title: Asynchronous Js
Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.description: Hey, time-traveling coder! ⏰ You've mastered DOM manipulation and ES6+ features—now it's time to conquer asynchronous JavaScript, the magic that lets your code handle tasks that take time, like fetching data, waiting for timers, or responding to user clicks without freezing the page. JavaScript is single-threaded (one task at a time), but async tricks make it feel multitasking!

Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.title: JS Promises
Javascript/Intermediate/async-javascript.description: Welcome to the Promise land! 🌟 After wrestling with callback hell, Promises are like a breath of fresh air. They represent a value that might be available now, later, or never. Think of a Promise as a receipt for your coffee order—it's either fulfilled (coffee ready!), rejected (sorry, we're out!), or still pending (brewing...).

Javascript/Intermediate/dom-manipulation.title: DOM Manipulation
Javascript/Intermediate/dom-manipulation.description: You’ve got functions, arrays, and objects down, and now it’s time to take control of web pages with DOM manipulation. The Document Object Model (DOM) is like a bridge between your JavaScript code and the HTML/CSS on a page. It turns your webpage into a living, breathing thing you can change on the fly—think updating text, styling buttons, or adding new elements with a click.

Javascript/Intermediate/error-handling.title: Error Handling
Javascript/Intermediate/error-handling.description: You’re fetching data and manipulating the DOM like a champ, but sometimes things go wrong—invalid inputs, network failures, or pesky bugs. That’s where error handling comes in, saving your app from crashing and keeping users happy. Think of it as your code’s safety net, catching problems before they spiral out of control.

Javascript/Intermediate/es6-features.title: ES6+ Features
Javascript/Intermediate/es6-features.description: You’re rocking the DOM and advanced functions—now it’s time to embrace the sleek, modern vibes of ES6+ (ECMAScript 2015 and later). These features, introduced starting in 2015, make JavaScript more powerful and fun to write. Think of them as upgrades to your coding spaceship: faster, smoother, and packed with cool tricks.

Javascript/Intermediate/final-projects.title: Final Projects
Javascript/Intermediate/final-projects.description: 🎉 Congratulations, JavaScript Master! You've conquered variables, functions, DOM manipulation, ES6+, async programming, and error handling. Now it's time to put it all together with some epic final projects that will challenge your skills and build your portfolio!

Javascript/Intermediate/json-apis.title: JSON and APIs
Javascript/Intermediate/json-apis.description: You’ve mastered async JavaScript, so now it’s time to talk to the world using JSON and APIs. JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is like a universal language for data—lightweight, readable, and used everywhere from apps to servers. APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) are like doorways to fetch or send that data, letting your app grab jokes, weather, or user info from the internet.
